DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine effect fat tissue-released miRNA skeletal muscle abnormal fat tissue-released miRNA contributes insulin resistance obese individual . This information important understanding body 's sugar metabolism regulate people obese become insulin resistant likely develop type 2 diabetes .
DOC.brief_title: Effect AT-derived miRNA Biology Insulin Sensitivity Skeletal Muscle Humans
DOC.detailed_description: Study Objectives : 1 . To establish optimize methodology measure adipose tissue miRNA release . 2 . To establish optimize methodology measure effect adipose tissue-released miRNA skeletal muscle biology insulin sensitivity . 3 . To profile adipose tissue-released miRNA lean insulin-sensitive obese insulin-resistant healthy individual . 4 . To examine effect adipose tissue-released miRNA lean insulin-sensitive individual obese insulin-resistant individual skeletal muscle biology insulin sensitivity .
DOC.criteria: Able communicate meaningfully investigator legally competent provide inform write consent 1865 year age BMI 2025 kg/m2 ( lean subject ) ; 3035 kg/m2 ( obese subject ) Stable body weight ( < 3 kg change last 8 week ) homeostatic model assessment ( HOMA ) insulin resistance < 2.7 lean ; homeostatic model assessment ( HOMA ) insulin resistance ≥2.7 obese Lactation pregnancy , current and/or within last 6 month , per participant 's report Female subject postmenopausal Cardiovascular disease ( unstable angina , myocardial infarction coronary revascularization within 6 month ) Liver disease ( AST ALT ( alanine aminotransferase ) > 2.5 time upper limit normal ) Kidney disease ( creatinine > 1.6 mg/dl ) Anemia ( hemoglobin < 12 g/dl men , < 11 g/dl woman ) Thyroid dysfunction ( abnormal TSH ) HbA1c ≥6.5 % Uncontrolled hypertension ( systolic BP > 160 mmHg , diastolic BP > 100 mmHg ) History coagulopathies History ( within last 5 year ) presence malignancy , ( skin cancer , exception melanoma , may acceptable ) Current history drug abuse alcohol abuse ( > 2 drinks/day ) Prior treatment ( within last 3 month ) systemic glucocorticoid ( > 2 week ) , betablockers , drug weight loss , niacin fibrates History HIV , active Hepatitis B C , Tuberculosis ( participant report ) Smoke > 5 cigarette per day
